19. DATA PROTECTION
19.1 The Company takes its data protection obligations very seriously and complies with its legal obligations under the General Data Protection Regulation and the Data Protection Act 2018 to protect the privacy and security of the Executive's personal information. As a data controller the Company is required to inform the Executive how we hold and use his information.
perturbation.changed_text:
17. OFFICE AS A DIRECTOR
17.1 Any office or directorship which the Executive holds in any Group Company is subject to the articles of association of the relevant company from time to time. 17.2 The Executive is required to familiarise himself with all his responsibilities as a director, legal and/or otherwise.

perturbation.explanation: Relocating the Data Protection clause to the 'Office as a Director' section buries the disclosure within a section about director responsibilities. This makes it less visible and accessible to the Executive, who might not expect to find information about their data protection rights in this section.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Data Protection Regulation, Data Protection Act 2018

perturbation.original_text:
20. GRIEVANCE AND DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURE
20.1 If the Executive is dissatisfied with any disciplinary decision relating to him, including any decision to dismiss him, he will have the right to appeal to the Chairman of WPP plc, whose decision will be final.
20.2 If the Executive seeks to redress any grievance relating to his employment, the Executive should raise this in the first instance with the Chairman. If the matter is not satisfactorily resolved, the Executive should then apply in writing to the Board and the Board's decision will be final.
perturbation.changed_text:
11. HOLIDAYS
11.1 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December (the Holiday Year). The Executive is entitled to 25 days' paid holiday in addition to the usual public or bank holidays in England) in every Holiday Year, to be taken at times convenient to the Company.
20.1 If the Executive is dissatisfied with any disciplinary decision relating to him, including any decision to dismiss him, he will have the right to appeal to the Chairman of WPP plc, whose decision will be final.
20.2 If the Executive seeks to redress any grievance relating to his employment, the Executive should raise this in the first instance with the Chairman. If the matter is not satisfactorily resolved, the Executive should then apply in writing to the Board and the Board's decision will be final.
11.2 No accrued but untaken holiday may be carried forward to the next holiday year and will lapse unless the Executive has been prevented from taking holiday due to sickness or statutory family leave to which he is or may be entitled further to Company policy from time to time.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the grievance and disciplinary procedure under 'Holidays' creates confusion. Employees would not logically look for grievance procedures under holiday entitlements, hindering their ability to understand and exercise their rights. This makes the procedure less discoverable and enforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Employment Rights Act 1996 (general principles of fair treatment)
